description: Proportional scoring evaluated daily: (Actual/Target) × 100%. Use when partial daily progress should count and evaluation is per day. Examples: 6/10 daily sessions = 60%, 8000/10000 daily steps = 80%. Can set minimum threshold and maximum cap.

description: Proportional scoring evaluated daily, then frequency-based success within a trailing 7-day window. Use for 'achieve X target on Y of Z days' where partial daily progress counts and frequency matters. Examples: 90min activity on 5 of 7 days (70min = 78% toward daily target), sedentary limits on 6 of 7 days. Daily score = (Actual/Target) × 100%, then frequency score = (Days meeting threshold/Target days) × 100%.

description: Composite weighted scoring evaluated daily: combines multiple factors with specified weights each day. Use when recommendation has multiple measurable components that are assessed daily. Example: fruit servings (60%) + variety (40%) = weighted daily score.
linked_recommendations: recMEPqal9VglyK6U, rechz1JGiQJCv9YJo, recMWhvrT57rQOSyU, recTnxfnpWuWO6CRg, recIoVf6FOKFcUX8p, recApH4t4nFb8maup, reckLfq4q5YH3ChjU, recXYBL9UD1QWCF3t, recNyDfLvFBteUfQI

description: Composite weighted scoring evaluated daily, then frequency-based success within a trailing 7-day window. Use when recommendation has multiple measurable components AND frequency matters. Example: fruit servings (60%) + variety (40%) achieved on 5 of 7 days. Daily score = weighted average of components, then frequency score = (Days meeting threshold/Target days) × 100%.
minimum_frequency: Defined per use case (e.g., '5 of 7 days')

description: Zone-based scoring with 5 performance tiers, evaluated daily and averaged over period. Use when there are optimal ranges with diminishing returns on either side. Example: sleep duration where both too little and too much are suboptimal, averaged over time.
grace_range_definition: Graduated scoring near tier boundaries to avoid arbitrary penalties

description: Zone-based scoring with 5 performance tiers, evaluated based on hitting optimal zone frequency within a trailing 7-day window. Use when optimal ranges matter AND frequency consistency is important. Example: sleep 7-9 hours on 5 of 7 nights.
grace_range_definition: Graduated scoring near tier boundaries to avoid arbitrary penalties
minimum_frequency: Defined per use case (e.g., '5 of 7 days in optimal zone')

description: Zone-based scoring with 3 performance tiers, evaluated daily and averaged over period. Use for simpler optimal range scenarios. Example: blood pressure zones (low/normal/high), averaged over time.
grace_range_definition: Graduated scoring near tier boundaries to avoid arbitrary penalties

description: Zone-based scoring with 3 performance tiers, evaluated based on hitting optimal zone frequency within a trailing 7-day window. Use for simpler optimal range scenarios where frequency consistency matters. Example: screen time <4 hours on 6 of 7 days.
grace_range_definition: Graduated scoring near tier boundaries to avoid arbitrary penalties
minimum_frequency: Defined per use case (e.g., '6 of 7 days in optimal zone')
